subject: Economics
title: Bitcoin: Money Without a Government
description: A short lesson to help you apply Bitcoin: Money Without a Government.

hook.text: In 2009, someone called Satoshi Nakamoto created a currency no government controls. Nobody knows who Satoshi is.

buildup.text: Bitcoin uses a shared ledger (blockchain) verified by thousands of computers. No bank, no central authority needed.

discovery.text: Only 21 million bitcoins will ever exist. Scarcity is enforced by code, not by any government's discipline.

twist.text: Bitcoin uses more electricity than Argentina. The environmental cost of trustless money is staggering.

climax.text: Bitcoin asked: what if money didn't need trust in institutions? The answer shook the entire financial system.

punchline.text: The biggest monetary experiment in history was started by a ghost.

quiz.question: What makes Bitcoin fundamentally different from traditional currencies?
options: Its supply is fixed by code with no central authority controlling it
